column1: perception  of  legal  certainty  becomes  negative  when  the  authorities  on  their  own  have  given
assurances which give rise to their expectations and later arbitrarily infringe the same.
In the case of S. M. Samrath vs Sri Lanka Medical Council SC FR 119/ 2019 it was held as follows;

other party should act upon it" the principal of legitimate expectation is connected with an
administrative authority and an individual. It emerges in an instance where an administrative
